title: From which books should I study for the DSE and other economics entrance exams? - Quora

response.answer_text: As a student of B.A. (Economics) in DU, I can buy the compiled readings from the campus which consists of all the text mentioned on the DSE website as a bunch of photocopies for each subject. If you live in Delhi you can do the same by going to SRCC photocopy shop or DSE photocopy shop both of which are in north campus. If you don't put up in Delhi, I'm sorry in that case as I've no escape for your refuge. :(And for UPSC optional you need to study both graduation and post graduation leveled economics. Graduation syllabus for preparation should be preferably as mentioned on DSE site and for post graduation study material, JNU will be better. Of all that I know, optional of economics comes in two sects: 1. Indian Economy and 2. World Economy. And JNU has M.A. in world economics as one of their prestigious course which is handy for UPSC preparation too. Indian economy is sufficient of graduation level only if you can relate those foreign authors' books mentioned on DSE site in the Indian context as well.

The list is suggestive, not exhaustive. Macroeconomics - Blanchard. For problem solving, refer to past year exam papers and cover all the growth and is-lm problems. They are not hard , just do them so that you get hold of the underlying mechanics. Microeconomics - schnider and Nicholson. If you do the exercises, they pretty much do the job. Mathematics - simon and Blume. Statistics - degroot Econometrics - damodar gujrati
